alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Franklin; Lyon; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 12:30AM CDT until July 05 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR FRANKLIN...ANDERSON...SOUTHEASTERN OSAGE...COFFEY AND SOUTHEASTERN LYON COUNTIES... At 1229 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lane to 4 miles northeast of Westphalia to near Gridley, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ottawa, Garnett, Burlington, Lebo, Pomona, Waverly, Richmond, Colony, Williamsburg, New Strawn, Quenemo, Melvern, Hartford, Gridley, Greeley, Princeton, Lane, Rantoul, Westphalia and Kincaid. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 147 and 194. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
